questions.question: Which storage service can be used as a low-cost option for hosting static websites?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is a low-cost object storage service that supports static website hosting, making it ideal for serving HTML, CSS, images, and other static content.

questions.question: Which Amazon EC2 instance pricing model can provide discounts of up to 90%?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances use unused EC2 capacity and can provide discounts of up to 90% compared to On-Demand pricing, but they can be interrupted when capacity is needed elsewhere.

questions.question: What is the AWS customer responsible for according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
questions.explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, customers are responsible for protecting their data, including encrypting data at rest and in transit.

questions.question: Which of the following AWS Cloud services can be used to run a customer-managed relational database?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 allows customers to run and manage their own relational databases, giving full control over the operating system and database software.

questions.question:
A company is looking for a scalable data warehouse solution.
Which of the following AWS solutions would meet the company's needs?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is AWSâ€™s fully managed, scalable data warehouse service designed for large-scale data analytics.

questions.question: Which statement best describes Elastic Load Balancing?

options.text: It translates a domain name into an IP address using DNS.
It distributes incoming application traffic across one or more Amazon EC2 instances.
It collects metrics on connected Amazon EC2 instances.
It automatically adjusts the number of Amazon EC2 instances to support incoming traffic.

questions.explanation: Elastic Load Balancing automatically distributes incoming application traffic across multiple EC2 instances to improve availability and fault tolerance.

questions.question: Which of the following are valid ways for a customer to interact with AWS services? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: Customers interact with AWS through the Command Line Interface (CLI) and Software Development Kits (SDKs) to programmatically manage AWS resources.

questions.question: The AWS Cloud's multiple Regions are an example of:
questions.explanation: AWS Regions are part of the AWS global infrastructure, allowing customers to deploy applications around the world.

questions.question: Which of the following AWS services can be used to serve large amounts of online video content with the lowest possible latency? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 stores the video content, and Amazon CloudFront delivers it through a global content delivery network, providing low-latency streaming to users.

questions.question:
Web servers running on Amazon EC2 access a legacy application running in a corporate data center.
What term would describe this model?
questions.explanation: This setup is called a hybrid architecture because it connects cloud-based resources with on-premises systems.

questions.question: What is the benefit of using AWS managed services, such as Amazon ElastiCache and Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)?

options.text: They require the customer to monitor and replace failing instances.
They have better performance than customer-managed services.
They simplify patching and updating underlying OSs.
They do not require the customer to optimize instance type or size selections.

questions.explanation: Managed services like RDS and ElastiCache automate tasks such as operating system patching and updates, reducing administrative overhead for customers.

questions.question: Which service provides a virtually unlimited amount of online highly durable object storage?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 provides virtually unlimited, highly durable object storage for storing any amount of data.

questions.question: Which of the following Identity and Access Management (IAM) entities is associated with an access key ID and secret access key when using AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI)?
questions.explanation: Access keys used by the AWS CLI are associated with an IAM user and provide programmatic access to AWS services.

questions.question: Which of the following security-related services does AWS offer? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: AWS provides security checks through Trusted Advisor and supports data encryption to help protect customer workloads.

questions.question: Which AWS managed service is used to host databases?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS is a managed AWS service used to host, operate, and scale relational databases in the cloud.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a simple and scalable shared file storage solution for use with Linux-based AWS and on-premises servers?
questions.explanation: Amazon EFS is a fully managed shared file system that works with Linux-based AWS and on-premises servers.

questions.question: When architecting cloud applications, which of the following are a key design principle?
questions.explanation: Elasticity allows cloud applications to automatically scale resources up or down based on demand.

questions.question: Which AWS service should be used for long-term, low-cost storage of data backups?
questions.explanation: Amazon Glacier is designed for long-term, low-cost storage of backups and archival data.

questions.question: Which task is AWS responsible for in the shared responsibility model for security and compliance?

options.text: Granting access to individuals and services

questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for encrypting data in transit as part of securing the underlying cloud infrastructure.

questions.question: Where should a company go to search software listings from independent software vendors to find, test, buy and deploy software that runs on AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS Marketplace is a digital catalog where customers can find, buy, and deploy software from independent vendors.

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using the AWS Cloud?

options.text: Permissive security removes the administrative burden.
Ability to focus on revenue-generating activities.
Choice of specific cloud hardware vendors.

questions.explanation: By using AWS, companies can focus more on revenue-generating activities instead of managing physical infrastructure.

questions.question: When performing a cost analysis that supports physical isolation of a customer workload, which compute hosting model should be accounted for in the Total Cost of Ownership (TCO)?
questions.explanation: Dedicated Hosts provide physical isolation by running EC2 instances on servers dedicated to a single customer, which must be included in TCO calculations.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides the ability to manage infrastructure as code?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudFormation lets customers define and manage their infrastructure using code, enabling consistent and repeatable deployments.

questions.question: If a customer needs to audit the change management of AWS resources, which of the following AWS services should the customer use?
questions.explanation: AWS Config tracks and records configuration changes to AWS resources, making it ideal for auditing and compliance.

questions.question: What is Amazon CloudWatch?

options.text: A code repository with customizable build and team commit features.
A metrics repository with customizable notification thresholds and channels.
A security configuration repository with threat analytics.
A rule repository of a web application firewall with automated vulnerability prevention features.

questions.explanation: Amazon CloudWatch is a monitoring service that stores metrics and allows customers to set alarms and notifications.

questions.question: Which service allows a company with multiple AWS accounts to combine its usage to obtain volume discounts?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations provides consolidated billing so usage from multiple accounts can be combined to receive volume discounts.

questions.question: Which of the following services could be used to deploy an application to servers running on-premises? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: AWS OpsWorks and AWS CodeDeploy can both deploy applications to servers running in on-premises environments.

questions.question: Which Amazon EC2 pricing model adjusts based on supply and demand of EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances have prices that change based on supply and demand for unused EC2 capacity.

questions.question: Which design principles for cloud architecture are recommended when re-architecting a large monolithic application? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: Loose coupling and designing for scalability allow applications to grow and handle failures more effectively.

questions.question: Which is the MINIMUM AWS Support plan that allows for one-hour target response time for support cases?
questions.explanation: The Business Support plan is the lowest tier that offers a one-hour response time for high-priority issues.

questions.question: Where can AWS compliance and certification reports be downloaded?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides access to AWS compliance and certification reports such as SOC and ISO documents.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a customized view of the health of specific AWS services that power a customer's workloads running on AWS?
questions.explanation: The AWS Personal Health Dashboard gives a personalized view of the health of AWS services affecting your workloads.

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of consolidated billing on AWS?
questions.explanation: Consolidated billing combines usage across multiple accounts, allowing customers to qualify for volume-based pricing discounts.

questions.question: Which of the following steps should be taken by a customer when conducting penetration testing on AWS?

options.text: Conduct penetration testing using Amazon Inspector, and then notify AWS support.
Request and wait for approval from the customer's internal security team, and then conduct testing.
Notify AWS support, and then conduct testing immediately.
Request and wait for approval from AWS support, and then conduct testing.

questions.explanation: Customers must request and receive approval from AWS before conducting penetration testing on certain AWS resources.

questions.question: Which of the following AWS features enables a user to launch a pre-configured Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance?
questions.explanation: An Amazon Machine Image (AMI) is a pre-configured template used to launch EC2 instances.

questions.question: How would an AWS customer easily apply common access controls to a large set of users?

options.text: Apply an IAM policy to an IAM group.
Apply an IAM policy to an IAM role.
Apply the same IAM policy to all IAM users with access to the same workload.
Apply an IAM policy to an Amazon Cognito user pool.

questions.explanation: Applying IAM policies to IAM groups allows administrators to manage permissions for many users at once.

questions.question: Which AWS Cost Management tool allows you to view the most granular data about your AWS bill?
questions.explanation: The AWS Cost and Usage Report provides the most detailed and granular data about AWS costs and usage.

questions.question: Which of the following can an AWS customer use to launch a new Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) cluster? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: Customers can launch Amazon RDS clusters using AWS CloudFormation or through the AWS Management Console.

questions.question: Which of the following is an AWS Cloud architecture design principle?
questions.explanation: Loose coupling allows application components to operate independently, improving resilience and scalability.

questions.question: Which of the following security measures protect access to an AWS account? (Select TWO.)

options.text: Grant least privilege access to IAM users.
Create one IAM user and share with many developers and users.
Activate multi-factor authentication (MFA) for privileged users.

questions.explanation: Granting least-privilege access and enabling MFA help protect AWS accounts from unauthorized access.

questions.question: Which service provides a hybrid storage service that enables on-premises applications to seamlessly use cloud storage?
questions.explanation: AWS Storage Gateway allows on-premises applications to seamlessly use AWS cloud storage.

questions.question: Which of the following services falls under the responsibility of the customer to maintain operating system configuration, security patching, and networking?
questions.explanation: With Amazon EC2, customers are responsible for managing the operating system, security patching, and networking.

questions.question: Which of the following is an important architectural design principle when designing cloud applications?
questions.explanation: Using multiple Availability Zones improves fault tolerance and increases application availability.

questions.question: Which AWS support plan includes a dedicated Technical Account Manager?
questions.explanation: The Enterprise Support plan includes a dedicated Technical Account Manager (TAM).

questions.question: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) offers which of the following benefits over traditional database management?

options.text: AWS manages the data stored in Amazon RDS tables.
AWS manages the maintenance of the operating system.
AWS automatically scales up instance types on demand.

questions.explanation: Amazon RDS manages the underlying operating system, reducing the administrative burden on customers.

questions.question: Which service is best for storing common database query results, which helps to alleviate database access load?
questions.explanation: Amazon ElastiCache stores frequently accessed data in memory, reducing database load and improving performance.

questions.question: Which of the following is a component of the shared responsibility model managed entirely by AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for the physical security and auditing of its data center infrastructure.

questions.question: Which options does AWS make available for customers who want to learn about security in the cloud in an instructor-led setting? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: AWS Online Tech Talks and AWS Classroom Training provide instructor-led education on cloud security.

questions.question: Which of the following features can be configured through the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) Dashboard? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: The Amazon VPC Dashboard is used to configure networking components such as security groups and subnets.

questions.question: If each department within a company has its own AWS account, what is one way to enable consolidated billing?

options.text: Use AWS Budgets on each account to pay only to budget.
Contact AWS Support for a monthly bill.
Create an AWS Organization from the payer account and invite the other accounts to join.
Put all invoices into one Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket, load data into Amazon Redshift, and then run a billing report.

questions.explanation: AWS Organizations enables consolidated billing by linking multiple AWS accounts under one payer account.
